page.title: 02Birth of Redditch New Town.
page.content: In {1956 the Burrows family} moved into Wynyates Farm.They had over 90 acres and they kept approximately 60 Hereford cross cattle, 30 ewes , 300 deep litter hens and some free range.The present {Winyates Craft {Centre }was once the farm barn, cowshed and stable.The old farmhouse had no indoor toilet and pumped its water from two wells so in 1960 they built a new one. After school the two daughters helped their father on the farm.They had no one to play with except during holidays when children came to stay at a neighbouring farm.In 1965 the elder girl,Susan,saved her pocket money and {bought a calf for Â£8.Today it would {cost Â£110 The first she remebers hearing about Redditch being{designated a New Town} by {Sir Keith Joseph}was listening to
